name: Great Barrier Reef
hint: The world's largest coral reef system, stretching over 2,300 km along the northeast coast of Australia

name: Outback
hint: The vast, remote, arid interior of Australia, sparsely populated and largely desert or semi-arid land

name: Great Dividing Range
hint: Australia's most substantial mountain range, stretching along the entire eastern coast from Queensland to Victoria

name: Nullarbor Plain
hint: A vast flat, almost treeless limestone plateau spanning the border of South and Western Australia

name: Tasmania Wilderness
hint: A UNESCO World Heritage area covering about 20% of Tasmania, one of the last temperate wilderness areas on Earth

name: Milford Sound
hint: A dramatic fiord in New Zealand's Fiordland National Park, carved by glaciers and framed by steep cliffs

name: Uluru
hint: A massive sandstone monolith in central Australia, sacred to the Anangu Aboriginal people

name: Kakadu
hint: Australia's largest national park in the Northern Territory, with Aboriginal rock art dating back 20,000+ years
